title: SNAP (Food Stamps) - Federal Program
description: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program helps eligible individuals and families buy groceries and healthy food nationwide.
benefits: Monthly benefits on EBT card ($100-$2,000+ per month)
Access to fresh produce and healthy foods
Available in all 50 states and territories

eligibility.income: Gross income at or below 130% of Federal Poverty Level
eligibility.workRequirement: Able-bodied adults 18-49 must work or participate in training 20+ hours/week

requirements: Social Security card or proof of application
Proof of income for all household members
applicationProcess: Apply online through your state's portal

title: Medicaid - National Health Coverage
description: Free or low-cost health insurance coverage for eligible individuals and families in all states.
benefits: Mental health and substance abuse services

eligibility.income: Up to 138% of Federal Poverty Level (varies by state)
eligibility.residency: Must be a resident of the state where applying

requirements: Proof of citizenship or legal status

contact.phone: Call 211 or your state Medicaid office
contact.address: Apply through your state's Medicaid program

applicationProcess: Apply online through Healthcare.gov or state website

title: Section 8 Housing Choice Vouchers
description: Federal rental assistance program helping very low-income families afford decent housing nationwide.
benefits: Rental assistance paying portion of rent directly to landlord
Choice in housing location and type

eligibility.income: Extremely low income (30% of area median) prioritized

requirements: Proof of income for all household members
Social Security cards for all members
applicationProcess: Apply when waiting list opens at local housing authority
Search for housing if voucher awarded
deadlines: Applications accepted when waiting lists open (varies by location)

title: WIC Nutrition Program - Federal
description: Nutrition assistance for pregnant women, new mothers, and children under 5 years old nationwide.
benefits: Monthly food packages with healthy foods
Referrals to health and social services
Farmers market vouchers in many areas

eligibility.income: At or below 185% of Federal Poverty Level
eligibility.nutrition: At nutritional risk (determined by health screening)

requirements: Medical records for nutritional risk assessment

contact.address: Multiple WIC clinics in every state

title: LIHEAP Energy Assistance - Federal
description: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program helps with heating and cooling costs nationwide.

eligibility.income: At or below 150% of Federal Poverty Level (varies by state)
eligibility.vulnerability: Households with elderly, disabled, or children prioritized

requirements: Proof of income for all household members
applicationProcess: Apply through your state's LIHEAP program
Assistance paid directly to utility company

title: SBA Small Business Loans
description: Federal small business loans and resources to start, grow, and expand businesses nationwide.
benefits: Loans up to $5 million with favorable terms
Lower down payments than traditional loans

eligibility.business: Small business as defined by SBA size standards
eligibility.ownership: At least 51% owned by U.S. citizens

contact.address: Contact local SBA office or approved lender

applicationProcess: Prepare business plan and financial documents

title: Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC)
description: Federal tax credit for working people with low to moderate income, especially families with children.
benefits: Tax credit up to $7,430 for families with 3+ children
Credit up to $1,502 for workers without children
Refundable credit - can result in tax refund
Available even if you don't owe taxes

eligibility.income: Varies by filing status and number of children
eligibility.work: Must have earned income from work
eligibility.filing: Must file tax return even if not required

requirements: Social Security number for you, spouse, and children

contact.address: File through IRS or qualified tax preparer

applicationProcess: Receive credit as refund or reduced taxes owed
deadlines: Tax filing deadline (April 15 or extended date)

title: Federal Pell Grants
description: Federal grants for undergraduate education that don't need to be repaid.
benefits: Up to $7,395 per year for college expenses
Does not need to be repaid
Can be used at eligible colleges nationwide
deadlines: FAFSA deadline varies by state - apply early for maximum aid

title: Unemployment Insurance Benefits
description: Temporary financial assistance for workers who lost their job through no fault of their own.
benefits: Job search assistance and training programs

eligibility.employment: Lost job through no fault of your own

contact.address: Apply through your state's unemployment website

applicationProcess: File claim online or by phone immediately after job loss
File weekly claims to receive benefits

title: Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI)
description: Monthly cash benefits for people who can't work due to serious medical conditions.

eligibility.disability: Unable to work due to medical condition expected to last 12+ months
eligibility.work: Sufficient work credits from paying Social Security taxes

contact.address: Apply online or at local Social Security office

applicationProcess: Apply online or at Social Security office
Receive decision and benefits if approved

title: Child Care Development Block Grant
description: Federal program helping working families pay for child care nationwide.
benefits: Access to quality child care providers
Support for parents in work or training

eligibility.income: Varies by state, typically up to 85% of state median income
eligibility.activity: Working, in school, or job training

requirements: Proof of income and work/school schedule

contact.phone: Call 211 for local child care assistance
contact.address: Contact your state's child care assistance program

applicationProcess: Apply through your state's child care assistance program

title: VA Benefits for Veterans
description: Comprehensive benefits for military veterans including healthcare, disability, education, and housing.

eligibility.service: Military service in U.S. Armed Forces

contact.address: Contact local VA office or medical center
contact.hours: 24/7 crisis line, business hours for other services

applicationProcess: Apply online at VA.gov or visit VA office

title: Supplemental Security Income (SSI)
description: Monthly cash assistance for disabled individuals and seniors with limited income and resources.
benefits: Automatic Medicaid eligibility in most states
State supplemental payments in some states
requirements: Proof of citizenship or legal status

contact.address: Apply at local Social Security office

applicationProcess: Apply online, by phone, or in person

title: USDA Rural Development Loans
description: Home loans and grants for rural areas with no down payment required for eligible borrowers.

eligibility.income: Income limits based on area median income

title: Medicare Health Insurance
description: Federal health insurance program for people 65 and older and certain disabled individuals.
requirements: Proof of citizenship or legal residency
Premium payments (for Parts B and D)

contact.address: Apply online or at Social Security office
